bug.author: mantou16
bug.summary: pandas-profiling not compatible with pandas v1.0
bug.description:
Describe the bug pandas-profiling not compatible with pandas v1.0. The key method "ProfileReport" returns error "TypeError: concat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'join_axes'" as join_axes is deprecated starting from Pandas v1.0. <denchmark-link:url>https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/whatsnew/v1.0.0.html?highlight=concat</denchmark-link>
To Reproduce import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling def test_issueXXX(): df = pd.read_csv(r'') pf = pandas.profiling.ProfileReport(df) TypeError: concat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'join_axes' Version information:
Python version: 3.7. Environment: Command Line and Pycharm pandas-profiling: 1.4.1 pandas: 1.0

comments.comment: I"m getting the same error. was there a solution to this?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/neongreen13>@neongreen13</denchmark-link> to address this, I decided to downgrade pandas to before 1.0. To downgrade, I uninstalled Anaconda and reinstalled using the October 2019 installer from here: <denchmark-link:https://repo.anaconda.com/archive/>https://repo.anaconda.com/archive/</denchmark-link> ... Now I can use pandas_profiling.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/penock>@penock</denchmark-link> Thank you! that worked for me too - using pandas 0.25.0 in a new environment. Cheers!

I do not want to downgrade. If any one can let me know that with the current version of Anaconda, when this or are this error going to be taken care, so that we can use Pandas profiling. TypeError: concat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'join_axes'
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/penock>@penock</denchmark-link> can we do this by not reinstalling? Any other alternative?

Nope I haven't found a way. I would guess the pandas_profiling folks will fix it in the next couple months, and until then I'm using pandas 0.25 installed via installing the old Anaconda 3 from last October. <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On Sat, Apr 4, 2020 at 2:45 PM Himanshuaroraa ***@***.***> wrote: @penock <https://github.com/penock> can we do this by not reinstalling? Any other alternative?

Many issues are related to pandas v1: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/401>#401</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/409>#409</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/415>#415</denchmark-link> , etc. Working on a solution.
Having this exact issue, hoping this is resolved soon pandas = v1.0.1 pandas-profiling = v1.4.1
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/penock>@penock</denchmark-link> I have upgraded the pandas profiling to 1.3/1.4 and it works for me. you should all try that.

Hi All,
When we work and establish something -that's what we measure in the ongoing process and make it as a practice to run the process in the enterprise. If a product evolves it has a backward compatibility that makes it more sustainable.
Its good to research and explore and improve the product. But adoption of a product means its sustainable. So when a version changes it should have the backward compatibility in the pipeline of change. This is not here in case of pandas profiling so it fails in adopting the feature that anybody like to make it as industry standard.
I would rather prefer if there is a change in any product , its dependent should be technically capable of not dropping that feature, as most cases are not similar like this.
Thanks, Debashis

Pandas-profiling is now compatible with pandas 1+. For more information, please have a look at the v2.6.0 release notes.

The code has been changed and if you don't want to downgrade your program, try with this code instead of< join_axes>. For example, result = pd.concat([df1, df4], axis=1, join_axes=[df1.index]) --> result = pd.concat([df1, df4], axis=1).reindex(df1.index) Good luck for everyone!

Pandas-profiling is now compatible with pandas 1+. For more information, please have a look at the v2.6.0 release notes.
v2.6 is not available in conda yet?

Pandas-profiling is now compatible with pandas 1+. For more information, please have a look at the v2.6.0 release notes.
v2.6 is not available in conda yet?
It is!

Pandas-profiling is now compatible with pandas 1+. For more information, please have a look at the v2.6.0 release notes.
v2.6 is not available in conda yet?
It is!
conda install -c conda-forge pandas-profiling installs v1.4.1 by default

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/SiddhantSadangi>@SiddhantSadangi</denchmark-link> Could you please provide some details (OS, Conda version etc.) on this issue: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/conda-forge/pandas-profiling-feedstock/issues/22>conda-forge/pandas-profiling-feedstock#22</denchmark-link> . That way we can try to fix the issue. Does fixing the version work for you? conda install -c conda-forge pandas-profiling=2.6.0
yeah, I installed 2.6 via pip adding details to the issue
I have installed latest version of pandas-profiling and its working for me. conda install -c conda-forge/label/cf202003 pandas-profiling

I'm using Collabatory due to some issues with running Exoplanet code in Windows. It says that im running Pandas 1.0.3 and I've tried to update pandas-profiling which now says its running 2.6.0. I've tried running it in a new notebook however the error still persists.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hughesymendes>@hughesymendes</denchmark-link> Could you make a new issue with the following information: Could you provide the minimal information to reproduce this error? <denchmark-link:http://matthewrocklin.com/blog/work/2018/02/28/minimal-bug-reports>This guide</denchmark-link> can help crafting a minimal bug report.
the minimal code you are using to generate the report
which environment you are using:
operating system (e.g. Windows, Linux, Mac) Python version (e.g. 3.7) jupyter notebook, console or IDE such as PyCharm Package manager (e.g. pip, conda conda info) packages (pip freeze > packages.txt or conda list)
a sample or description of the dataset (df.head(), df.info())

<denchmark-h:h2>i get an error as follows: data=pd.DataFrame(np.array([[1,2,3,4],[5,6,7,8]])) ppf.ProfileReport(data)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
